resources.description: The full OSM planet as XML bzipped (massive).  This is the URL for a mirror server. See the [planet.osm wiki docs for other download mirrors and regional extracts](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Planet.osm#Worldwide_data)
resources.name: Latest daily dump of full Planet.osm

resources.description: The full OSM planet as PBF (massive).  PBF is a format for storing OSM data in a compact form. A domain specific compression format, readable by various OSM tools. This is the URL for a mirror server. See the [planet.osm wiki docs for other download mirrors and regional extracts](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Planet.osm#Worldwide_data)
resources.name: Latest daily dump of full Planet.pbf

resources.description: London data (as an example).  PBF is a format for storing OSM data in a compact form. A domain specific compression format, readable by various OSM tools.
resources.name: London data example (PBF)

resources.description: An example extract of OpenStreetMap data for London. This is in [.osm XML format](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/OSM_XML), gzipped.
resources.name: London data example (xml)

resources.description:
The "OpenStreetMap API" is designed to support OpenStreetMap editor software reading/writing geodata. It can be used for reading small quantities of data from the OSM database, but many developers may find the planet downloads and [region extracts](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Planet.osm#Country_and_area_extracts) more appropriate.

Also note that this is not an API for embedding maps on websites in javascript. For this you should look-up "[Leaflet](http://leafletjs.com)" or "[OpenLayers](http://openlayers.org)".
resources.name: OpenStreetMap Editor API

resources.description: Documentation of the OpenStreetMap editor API on the OpenStreetmap wiki. This lists all available methods of OSM's core read/write geodata API.
resources.name: OpenStreetMap Editor API Documentation

organization.description:
This is a group for datasets relevant for [Open Data Day](http://www.opendataday.org/). Anyone can add datasets to this group so please just hit edit and add the dataset (if the dataset is not yet on thedatahub please just  add it using the Add Dataset link at the top of the page -- you may need to log in first!).

International Open Data Hackathon Day is an annual event in which people around the world gather to write applications, liberate data, create visualisations and publish analyses using open public data to show support for and encourage the adoption of open data policies by the world's local, regional and national governments.

The [Open Knowledge Foundation] (www.okfn.org) and [CKAN] (http://ckan.org) will be running an open data hack day at the Barbican in London in support of the event. More details here: http://www.meetup.com/OpenKnowledgeFoundation/London-GB/536442/
organization.title: Open Data Day 2011
organization.name: open-data-day-2011

name: osm
notes:
![logo](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/w/images/thumb/7/79/Public-images-osm_logo.svg/24px-Public-images-osm_logo.svg.png) OpenStreetMap (OSM) is aimed at creating and providing free geographic data such as street maps to anyone who wants them. The project was started because most maps you think of as free actually have legal or technical restrictions on their use, holding back people from using them in creative, productive or unexpected ways.

### Raw Vector Data

Fundamentally OpenStreetMap offers maps as raw vector data released under an open license. The planet.osm downloads contain all of this data as a massive file for the entire planet, formatted in OSM's own XML format. It is a snapshot of the latest revision of the node, ways, relations and tags in the database. A new version is released weekly. You can also sync your copy of the planet on an daily, hourly or even minutely basis, bringing in map updates from the OpenStreetMap community

Documentation of OSM file formats can be found on their wiki at: <http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/OSM_file_formats>

Links for mirrors and at <http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Planet.osm> . Here you will also find details of downloads for smaller regional extracts of the data e.g. for countries or cities.

### Embedding a map
Web developers might typically be seeking to use OpenStreetMap in a manner similar to google maps. Note that the "OpenStreetMap API" is not what you are looking for. Instead look-up "Leaflet", "OpenLayers", or [other javascript libraries for embedding a map](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Deploying_your_own_Slippy_Map)

<http://switch2osm.org>  is a website designed to help developers switch to using OpenStreetMap.
title: OpenStreetMap
